title: Accessible Typography Standards
subtitle: Font selection, sizing, and spacing guidelines for academic documents
latexDescription: Use this template for creating accessible LaTeX documents:
cssDescription: Apply these CSS rules for accessible web typography:

items.fonts: Use sans-serif fonts (Arial, Helvetica) or accessible serif fonts
items.spacing: Line spacing at least 1.5 for body text
items.contrast: Minimum 4.5:1 contrast ratio for normal text

items.consistent: Use consistent font families throughout the document
items.hierarchy: Establish clear heading hierarchy (H1, H2, H3)
items.emphasis: Use bold for emphasis, avoid underlining
items.capitalization: Avoid all-caps text except for acronyms
items.color: Don't rely on color alone to convey information
